BookData.Title: 1991 census
BookData.TitleLong: 1991 census: final counts of persons by age and sex for statistical local areas: Northern Territory
BookData.Summary: This publication contains final data from the 1991 census for the Northern Territory of Australia. It represents census counts of the age and sex of the persons in Statistical Local Areas (SLAs) and Statistical Divisions (SDs). The counts are by where people were located on census night, not by address given.

BookData.Title: 1994 NWT visitor center survey
BookData.TitleLong: 1994 NWT visitor center survey overall results
BookData.PublisherText: Yellowknife : Bureau of Statistics ; Dept. of Public Works & Services, 1995.
BookData.Summary: Presents and discusses results of a survey of users at six visitor centres across the Northwest Territories, conducted between June and September 1994. Statistical highlights presented include information on: counts of visitors and trip characteristics including group size, transportation mode, type of accommodation, days spent in the area, reasons for visiting, and sources of prior information about the area; visitor satisfaction with features of the centre and impact on travel plans; characteristics of visitors including age, sex, educational level, and household income; and group counts and expenditures for visitors who were not Northwest Territories residents. A copy of the survey questionnaire is appended.

BookData.Title: 1, 001 facts about the human body
BookData.AuthorsText: written by Sarah Brewer; additional material by Naomi Craft
BookData.Notes:
"Some of the material in this book originally appeared in 'Pockets Human Body' published by Dorling Kindersley Ltd."--T.p. verso.
Includes index.
Introduction to the body: Evolution of the human body -- Body systems -- Cells -- Body structures: Skeleton -- Bone -- Skull -- Spine -- Joints -- Muscular system -- Hair and nails -- Brain and nervous system: Nervous system -- Brain -- Spinal cord -- Senses -- Heart, blood, and lungs: Cardiovascular system -- Heart -- Blood -- Fighting infection -- Endocrine system -- Respiratory system -- Digestion and excretion: Digestive system -- Mouth and teeth -- Stomach -- Intestines -- Liver and pancreas -- Urinary system -- Reproduction: Reproductive systems -- Sex and fertilization -- Pregnancy and birth -- Genetics and heredity -- Growing up -- Growing old -- Body facts: Pregnancy and birth -- Cells and tissue -- Senses -- Hormones -- Growing up and death -- Food and nutrition -- Immune systems -- Ovaries and urination -- Circulation and the heart -- Skin, hair, and nails -- Bones and teeth -- Muscles and exercise -- Brain and nerves -- Respiratory system -- Blood -- Genetics.

BookData.Title: 1-2-3 Be a Porn Star! A Step-By-Step Guide to the Adult Sex Industry
BookData.Summary: Have you ever considered a career in the adult industry? Do you fantasize about getting paid to enjoy hot sex in exotic locations with beautiful people? The porn world is booming, with over 10,000 new adult videos released every year, but entering this secretive industry can be a trying experience. 1-2-3 BE A PORN STAR! shows you how to make your fantasy come true in three easy steps. You'll find out who the right people are, how you can meet them, and how to land your all-important first job. Whether you're male or female, 1-2-3 BE A PORN STAR! makes it easy to cut through the usual obstacles. You'll get up-to-date contact information for all the best talent agents, directors, and producers, along with advice in their own words for how to ensure your success. Plus you'll enjoy exclusive interviews with legendary porn stars such as Jill Kelly, Max Hardcore, Nina Hartley, Peter North, Stacy Valentine, Randy West, Sharon Mitchell, Ashlyn Gere, Guy DeSilva, Annabel Chong and many more. Please note that 1-2-3 BE A PORN STAR! focuses only on adult employment that is legal. Industry opportunities covered in the book include amateur, mainstream, hardcore, softcore, fetish, gonzo, gay, bi, lesbian, transsexual, and couples. Extensive discussion is devoted to the question of how to make your own adult videos. In addition to the video industry, the book also details opportunities in cable, CD-ROM, DVD, print media, and the booming Internet arena. An entire chapter is devoted to health and safety issues for adult performers.

BookData.Title: 1,410 Quintessential Quizzes
BookData.Summary: Test your knowledge, challenge your memory, and entertain your senses with more than 1,400 supremely enjoyable quizzes. The categories range from sex to Shakespeare, sports to movies, food to money, and every one is filled with intriguing questions. Which rock group went the longest without a change in members? Which President gave the longest inaugural address—and as a result served the shortest term in office? What was God’s first command? Each quiz provides an amazing amount of information—and a barrel of fun.Answers:1. The Who2. William Henry Harrison3. Let There Be Light

BookData.Title: 2004 Chief Medical Officer of Health report
BookData.TitleLong: 2004 Chief Medical Officer of Health report healthy weights, healthy lives
BookData.PublisherText: Toronto : Chief Medical Officer of Health, 2004.
BookData.Summary: Recent information has shown that rates of overweight & obesity are reaching epidemic proportions in Ontario. This report describes the link between body weight and health; defines healthy & unhealthy weights for children & adults; reviews approaches to achieving & maintaining healthy weights; analyzes the current situation in Ontario with regard to weight problems (by age, sex, & region) and eating & physical activity habits; discusses the complex biological, life-style, socio-economic, cultural, & environmental factors that determine body weight; and examines the steps that government, the health system, the food industry, workplaces, schools, communities, parents & caregivers, and individuals can take to help achieve & maintain healthy body weights.
BookData.Notes:
French ed. : World Wide Web.
Includes bibliography.
Microfiche.Toronto, Ont. :Micromedia Ltd.

BookData.Title: 2006 Our Sunday Visitors Catholic Almanac
BookData.TitleLong: 2006 Our Sunday Visitors Catholic Almanac (Our Sunday Visitor's Catholic Almanac)
BookData.Summary: A valuable reference work. The trusted resource. Still. This annual, up-to-date, comprehensive guide to the Catholic Church has been the reference work to which students, teachers, researchers, homilists, writers, and media professionals have turned for more than 100 years. This is the resource on which they have relied for solid, orthodox Catholic teaching and information. This is the reference work with the in-depth index that makes it easy to find specific, exact information. This is the resource endorsed by Archbishop John Foley, President of the Pontifical Council on Social Communication at the Vatican, who writes: "It is an annual masterpiece!" Topics in the 2005 edition include:  The Year in Review  Special Reports on Same-Sex Unions, the Sex Abuse Scandal, Catholics in Political Life, and Pope John Paul II's 25th Anniversary  Coverage of the new document on Catholic Devotions  Update on Partial-Birth Abortion and other Life Issues  Biographies of the New Cardinals  Full Coverage of Mother Teresa's Beatification  Biographies of all new Saints and Blesseds  Updates on Papal Travel  Updated National and World Statistics  Updated Statistics on Men and Women Religious  Catholic Social Teachings  Mary  Canon Law  Glossary of Catholic Terms  Church Calendar  Scripture  Liturgy  Sacraments  Chronologies of U.S. and World Church History  Coverage on the rules for Papal Conclaves  Ecumenism  Encyclicals And more! "Our Sunday Visitor claims this work is the `one and only Catholic resource' and it is `simply the best annual guide to the Catholic Church anywhere.' These are bold statements, but accurate . . . This excellent work is especially useful for those interested in either the Roman Catholic Church or the Holy See . . . It is informative, easy to use, and well written."  American Reference Books Manual, 2003.

BookData.Title: 2007-Eleven
BookData.Summary: From the pages of The New Yorker, The New York Times, and Slate stagger Frank Cammuso and Hart Seely, restoring a cheerful sanity to our deranged lives and times.Every now and then, funny writing somehow manages to retain full possession of literary quality. Please see Twain, Heller, Benchley, Parker, Frazier, Geng. And now please see Cammuso and Seely. If you're not some famous person in our hyped, commodified, three-screen (movie, TV, computer), celeb-ridden society, count your blessings. Because if you are, Cammuso and Seely will probably get you sooner or later. They got Martha Stewart--they have her planning gracious plans for her version of the Son of God's final repast: "Jesus has indicated--against my better wishes--that He intends to gird Himself with a towel and wash everybody's feet. So be it. But beforehand, I'll run his terry cloth for five minutes in the dryer, making it toasty and soft." They (fondly) postu-late how Phil Rizzuto might have written a characteristically fractionated version of "Casey at the Bat": "'Fraud!' cried the maddened thousands, and the echo murmured 'Fraud.' / Hey, Murcer! Look! Bea Arthur! Didn't she play Maude?" The Flintstones become the Clintstones, Quentin Tarantino directs The Three Little Pigs, and Dr. Seuss collaborates poetically with Rod Serling.Even when the targets of these pieces are of the moment, Cammuso and Seely's humor will endure. What's more evanescent than pop-music stardom? Sex, maybe, but not much else. But who won't laugh, even years from now, as Cammuso and Seely--in "Six Degrees of Chuck Berry"--introduce some of the record industry's often interchangeable personages to each other: "Tanya, Enya. Enya, Shania. Shania, Mariah. Mariah, Wynonna. Wynonna, Fiona . . . " Nobody.From the Hardcover edition.
